about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

At all times.

At all times.

hasPart.name: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should:

about.name: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should:

hasPart.assesses: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should: | Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A wet, slippery road does not allow your tires the traction they need, so it is necessary to drive more slowly on a wet road than you would on a dry road. To reduce the risk of skidding, you should avoid fast turns or stops.

suggestedAnswer.text: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.

comment.text: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.

suggestedAnswer.text: Test your tires' traction while going uphill.

comment.text: Test your tires' traction while going uphill.

suggestedAnswer.text: Decrease the distance you look ahead of your vehicle.

comment.text: Decrease the distance you look ahead of your vehicle.

acceptedAnswer.text: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.

comment.text: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.

answerExplanation.text: A wet, slippery road does not allow your tires the traction they need, so it is necessary to drive more slowly on a wet road than you would on a dry road. To reduce the risk of skidding, you should avoid fast turns or stops.

comment.text: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should: | A wet, slippery road does not allow your tires the traction they need, so it is necessary to drive more slowly on a wet road than you would on a dry road. To reduce the risk of skidding, you should avoid fast turns or stops.

hasPart.name: This road sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This road sign means: | This road sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. This sign tells drivers that it is prohibited to make a U-turn.

comment.text: Do not enter.
Roundabout ahead.
No U-turns.
No U-turns.

answerExplanation.text: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. This sign tells drivers that it is prohibited to make a U-turn.

comment.text: This road sign means: | Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. This sign tells drivers that it is prohibited to make a U-turn.

hasPart.name: Always use your seat belt:
hasPart.assesses: Always use your seat belt: | Always use your seat belt: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Use of seat belts is required for the driver and all passengers, including children who are over 8 years old or are at least 4 feet 9 inches tall. You must wear seat belts and shoulder harnesses even if the vehicle has airbags. If your vehicle is equipped with separate lap and shoulder belts, you must use both.

suggestedAnswer.text: Unless the vehicle was built before 1978.

comment.text: Unless the vehicle was built before 1978.

suggestedAnswer.text: Unless you are in a limousine.

comment.text: Unless you are in a limousine.

suggestedAnswer.text: When the vehicle is equipped with seat belts.

comment.text: When the vehicle is equipped with seat belts.

acceptedAnswer.text: When the vehicle is equipped with seat belts.

comment.text: When the vehicle is equipped with seat belts.

answerExplanation.text: Use of seat belts is required for the driver and all passengers, including children who are over 8 years old or are at least 4 feet 9 inches tall. You must wear seat belts and shoulder harnesses even if the vehicle has airbags. If your vehicle is equipped with separate lap and shoulder belts, you must use both.

comment.text: Always use your seat belt: | Use of seat belts is required for the driver and all passengers, including children who are over 8 years old or are at least 4 feet 9 inches tall. You must wear seat belts and shoulder harnesses even if the vehicle has airbags. If your vehicle is equipped with separate lap and shoulder belts, you must use both.
